page.title: 12BUILDINGS
page.content:
There is a large church in Thurlstone and a non-conformist Chapel. All these buildings are constructed of distinc- tive local sandstone which has weathered a sombre grey hue. Building stone used to be quarried locally. There is a large disused quarry above Thurlstone, which has reverted to its wild state.
There are three small modern develop- ments in Millhouse - Copperas Close, the Birks Estate and a small council estate. Thurlstone also has a small area of council housing and 2 small modern developments. Post-war housing is of brick. There are a few small locally owned shops; 2 in Millhouse and some along the main road in Thurlstone.
